zone.line: Faust
Seeks he the oratorical power!
Is he no sounding-lute fool!
He bears understanding & right sense
With little art himself for;
And if you earnest are what to say
It is necessary words still to provide
Yes, your oration, which so brilliant is
In which you manhood Cutting curl
Is slow as a the Cloud-wind
Which autumnal thro dry leaves rushes
Wagner
Ah God! the art is long;
And short is our life
To me will be, thro my critical attempts
Still often around my heart & bosom anxious
How hard is not the middle to attain
Thro which then to the fountains ascend
And ere these yet the half way is reached
Must indeed a wretched devil fail
